name: nytimes
text:
RT @alanfeuer: NEW: It's been quite a week for long-awaited New York police reform.
First, the repeal of 50-A.
Then, the demise of the NYPD's anti-crime unit.
Today, the City Council passed the POST Act which enforces transparency on NYPD's vast surveillance apparatus. 
https://t.co/5uWULSFP7n

name: nytimes
text: The Trump administration on Thursday finalized a decision not to impose any limits on perchlorate, a toxic chemical compound found in rocket fuel that contaminates water and has been linked to fetal and infant brain damage https://t.co/PhMKyayzGz

name: nytimes
text: RT @NYTHealth: Studies show that “the most significant determinant of resilience is the quality of our close personal relationships, especially with parents and primary caregivers” — @eilenez on what makes some people more resilient than others https://t.co/q40eA1ZjLT

name: nytimes
text: A New Yorker takes a wistful stroll through memories of city haunts, now hidden behind boards and quarantine warning signs https://t.co/G36CQVsA7D

name: nytimes
text: RT @gettinviggy: A conservative activist who is an ardent supporter of President Trump was barred by American Airlines on Thursday, one day after he was removed from a flight from La Guardia Airport to Dallas-Fort Worth Airport after he refused to wear a mask. https://t.co/UFD4V2tpLi

text:

text: Speaker Nancy Pelosi ordered that portraits of 4 House speakers who served in the Confederacy be removed from the Capitol https://t.co/UpbFJsPenG https://t.co/j0ZOedQihO

text: A private art detective investigating the case of a stolen van Gogh painting said he was sent photographs of the work, which was taken from a Dutch museum in March https://t.co/P2p0A6tGsF

text:

name: nytimes
text: Twitter added a warning to a post from President Trump about a racist baby on Thursday, saying it contained manipulated media designed to mislead people. The video had been altered to appear as if CNN had broadcast it. https://t.co/5SIJgbe9ea

name: nytimes
text: RT @ewong: NEW: The biggest obstacle to China policy is Trump himself. He begged Xi to help him win re-election. He told Xi to keep building internment camps for Muslims. He ignored Hong Kong & coronavirus. He intervened in tech cases to help Xi. w/ @michaelcrowley. https://t.co/465G1hhrEf

name: nytimes
text: RT @NYTHealth: The author and activist @alexanderchee asks: Are the parallels between the coronavirus pandemic and the AIDS crisis in the nature of the viruses, or just an old story about America that had never changed? https://t.co/Qe6EdXtDGN

name: nytimes
text: Breaking News: 2 Canadians detained in China since 2018, Michael Kovrig and Michael Spavor, have been indicted on espionage charges, court officials said https://t.co/7UhTfSoT24

name: nytimes
text:
As coronavirus cases continue to mount in California, Gov. Gavin Newsom on Thursday ordered people to wear face masks in most indoor — and some outdoor — public settings.

Live updates about the pandemic: https://t.co/1BLD7SavOk https://t.co/2reThHOkNQ

name: nytimes
text: A wave of anti-Chinese anger is cresting across India as the nation reacts to the loss of 20 Indian soldiers beaten to death this week by Chinese troops in a brawl along India’s disputed border with China https://t.co/Zd7ymvRrdn

name: nytimes
text: The Southeastern Conference demanded that Mississippi remove the Confederate battle emblem from its state flag. Without change, the commissioner warned, the conference might not hold future championship events in Mississippi. https://t.co/Hy5SwwJ41r

name: nytimes
text: Nearly 80 million people, or 1% of humanity, now qualify as refugees, asylum seekers or internally displaced. The record figure caps a “tumultuous” decade of displacement, the United Nations said. https://t.co/R2tzQjErrJ

name: nytimes
text: RT @Abihabib: For years, the US has tried to persuade India to become a closer military partner in confronting China’s ambitions, a chance for the world’s largest democracy to counterbalance the largest autocracy. After this week’s clash with China, India may step up: https://t.co/XCyWozURkI

name: nytimes
text: RT @MarkLandler: Lloyd’s of London will make amends for having a slave owner among its early partners. Britain’s painful reckoning with its racist past moves from toppled statues in the town square to corporate boardrooms. https://t.co/xGgYTL7d2Z

name: nytimes
text: Europe morning briefing: Here's what you need to know to start your day https://t.co/BxYyklo8RZ

name: nytimes
text: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan lifted a coronavirus-related travel ban that had prohibited residents from moving between prefectures. The announcements came as Tokyo announced 41 new infections on Thursday. https://t.co/12VqdVdmFn

name: nytimes
text: Portugal’s Parliament voted to honor Aristides de Sousa Mendes, who provided Jews and others in Nazi-occupied France with visas allowing them to flee the country https://t.co/zLIoHbWIMG

name: nytimes
text: China lashed out at the U.S. on Thursday after President Trump signed into law a bill that would allow him to impose sanctions on Chinese officials involved in the mass incarceration of more than one million Uighurs and other minorities in Xinjiang https://t.co/2I5vAlINCj

name: nytimes
text: “I was very surprised, and I did not believe him at first,” said the South Korean paleontologist who analyzed the prehistoric prints. “But he was right. The tracks prove they were bipedal.” https://t.co/2rg7Q7VPLK

name: nytimes
text: RT @livia_ar: In this week's Australia Letter, I pondered our return to normalcy... https://t.co/ZyRWTQTSAK

name: nytimes
text: Nearly 500 Russian medical workers are suspected to have died after contracting the virus, more than 4 times the number announced previously. If true, Russia’s overall death rate may also be considerably higher than reported. https://t.co/EMawAZWhX8

name: nytimes
text: News Analysis: The U.S. and its allies have long wanted India’s help in confronting China. This week, the idea of such a confrontation became more real as Indian and Chinese soldiers clashed in the worst violence on the countries’ border in 45 years. https://t.co/W1xpA2X5s4

name: nytimes
text: Two prominent British firms, Lloyd’s of London and Greene King, announced they would make amends for their involvement in the slave trade in the 18th and 19th centuries https://t.co/AUkVHQAJ02

name: nytimes
text: Stone-age burial mounds are among Ireland's most impressive monuments. Now one has yielded DNA evidence of behavior worthy of the pharaohs, what seems to be royal incest. https://t.co/tAYsMjmFnb

name: nytimes
text: Padma Lakshmi’s new food show asks difficult questions, expanding and redefining what it means to be American, writes @tejalrao https://t.co/P9OAKKDpCN

name: nytimes
text: Two photographs of a stolen van Gogh painting have surfaced. A private detective suspects that the images were circulated in criminal circles in an effort to find a potential buyer. https://t.co/73KrjqjuLh

name: nytimes
text: Wristwatches and fast cars are precision machines that have grown together for a century, drawing crowds and connoisseurs. “A watch is like a sports car that you can wear into a bar,” said a student of watch history. https://t.co/O79eZLKCF8

name: nytimes
text: 2 Russians said to be conducting a “research project” in Libya landed in jail on charges of political meddling. Their story is the latest episode of foreign intrigue amid Libya's chaotic war — and now an action movie. https://t.co/S3185ZCCCF

name: nytimes
text: As Japan looks to baseball for hope, part of the responsibility for healing will be placed in the right hand of a rare American starter who bounced around 4 Major League Baseball organizations before finding himself in Japan https://t.co/y1eF1QegOs

name: nytimes
nytimes
text: Details of the accusations against Danny Masterson are contained in a lawsuit filed last year by 4 women who say the actor sexually assaulted them and that the Church of Scientology, to which he belonged, embarked on a pressure campaign to silence them https://t.co/voVnHUMuwS

name: nytimes
text: Chinese lawmakers have been meeting behind closed doors in Beijing this week to push forward a proposed national security law that could drastically curtail free political expression in Hong Kong and add to China’s tensions with the West https://t.co/POcpPiEWmW

name: nytimes
text: Senator Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota announced late Thursday that she was withdrawing from consideration to be Joe Biden's running mate. "I believe that this is a moment to put a woman of color on that ticket," she said. https://t.co/9iVz7HchCb

text: Here's a rundown of the highlights worth watching from late-night TV https://t.co/dOJ8Bevtbu
